title: Stranded hiker rescued thanks to iPhone SOS feature
description: A stranded hiker in a remote Los Angeles canyon had no service but had her iPhone 14 which has a new SOS feature that allows a 911 call to go via satellite. NBC News’ Erin McLaughlin has more details on the rescue.

title: 1 of 6 people found dead in South Carolina house fire was 11-year-old daughter of murder suspect
description: The suspect in the investigation of a South Carolina house fire where six people were found dead was charged with the murder of his 11-year-old daughter, the prosecutor's office announced Monday.

title: Twitter’s chaotic weekend ends with more questions than answers
description: It was a chaotic weekend on Twitter. It started with sudden changes as to who could view tweets, followed by sudden changes as to how many tweets users could view, and times where many users couldn’t see tweets at all.

title: Activists spurred by affirmative action ruling challenge legacy admissions at Harvard
description: The complaint, filed by Lawyers for Civil Rights on behalf of Black and Latino community groups, alleges that Harvard’s admissions system violates the Civil Rights Act.

title: U.S. ambassador visits detained journalist Evan Gershkovich in Russian prison
description: U.S. Ambassador to Russia Lynne Tracy saw detained Wall Street Journal reported Evan Gershkovich on Monday, the second visit by the Biden administration since his arrest in March.

title: Little-known NJ baby retailer tentatively wins rights to Buy Buy Baby's IP for $15.5 million
description: A little-known baby retailer based in Piscataway, New Jersey, has tentatively won the auction for the intellectual property of Bed Bath & Beyond’s crown jewel Buy Buy Baby, according to court records.

title: U.S. maternal mortality more than doubled since 1999, and most deaths were among Black women
description: The number of U.S. women who died within a year after pregnancy more than doubled between 1999 and 2019, with the highest deaths among Black women, a new study found.

title: Triple-digit heat continues to scorch parts of the U.S.
description: A dangerous heat wave is baking much of the United States for yet another day, as states in the South and areas out West prepare for a scorching Fourth of July holiday.

title: Robert De Niro's 19-year-old grandson has died, actor says
description: Robert De Niro's 19-year-old grandson has died, the family said.

title: Hunter Biden prosecutor denies retaliating against IRS whistleblower
description: David Weiss, the U.S. Attorney tasked with investigating Hunter Biden's tax filings, denied retaliating against an IRS whistleblower.

title: U.S. recommends Americans reconsider traveling to China due to arbitrary law enforcement and exit bans
description: The U.S. recommended Americans reconsider traveling to China because of arbitrary law enforcement and exit bans and the risk of wrongful detentions.

title: Severe thunderstorms to hit parts of U.S. as heat wave persists in the South on the Fourth of July
description: Severe thunderstorms were expected across swaths of the eastern United States on Monday as the Southwest continued to swelter under a relentless heat wave through the long Fourth of July weekend.

title: How to avoid summer concert ticket scams online
description: Some of the hottest performers are on the road this summer — but you don’t want to get burned by scams when buying tickets online amid surging demand. NBC’s Vicky Nguyen reports for TODAY.

title: Truckers flooded the market during Covid. Now they struggle to pay their bills.
description: Over the past year, truck shipping rates have tumbled, leaving drivers who bet big on the trucking boom struggling to make a living.

title: Texas teen missing for more than 8 years is found alive
description: He went missing as a Texas teenager more than eight years ago and turned up alive Saturday as a 25-year-old man for whom that time remained a mystery.

title: Police seek people who targeted multiple D.C. sites  with explosive devices
description: Police were seeking the people who detonated or threw explosive devices at three closed business locations, including a Nike store and a bank, in Washington, D.C., early Sunday.
